verses.verse: For everything there is a season, <S%H2165><s%> and a time <S%H2165><s%> for every purpose <S%H2656><s%> under heaven: <S%H8064><s%>

a time <S%H6256><s%> to be born, <S%H3205><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to die; <S%H4191><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> to plant, <S%H5193><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to pluck up <S%H6131><s%> that which is planted; <S%H5193><s%>
a time <S%H6256><s%> to kill, <S%H2026><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to heal; <S%H7495><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> to break down, <S%H6555><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to build up; <S%H1129><s%>
a time <S%H6256><s%> to weep, <S%H1058><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to laugh; <S%H7832><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> to mourn, <S%H5594><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to dance; <S%H7540><s%>

a time <S%H6256><s%> to cast away <S%H7993><s%> stones, <S%H68><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to gather <S%H3664><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> together; <S%H3664><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> to embrace, <S%H2263><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to refrain <S%H7368><s%> from embracing; <S%H2263><s%>
a time <S%H6256><s%> to seek, <S%H1245><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to lose; <S%H6><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> to keep, <S%H8104><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to cast away; <S%H7993><s%>
a time <S%H6256><s%> to tear, <S%H7167><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to sew; <S%H8609><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> to keep silence, <S%H2814><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to speak; <S%H1696><s%>
a time <S%H6256><s%> to love, <S%H157><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> to hate; <S%H8130><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> for war, <S%H4421><s%> and a time <S%H6256><s%> for peace. <S%H7965><s%>
What profit <S%H3504><s%> has he who works <S%H6213><s%> in that in which <S%H834><s%> he labors? <S%H6001><s%>
I have seen <S%H7200><s%> the burden <S%H6045><s%> which God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> to be afflicted with. <S%H6031><s%>

He has made <S%H6213><s%> everything beautiful <S%H3303><s%> in its time. <S%H6256><s%> He has also set <S%H5414><s%> eternity <S%H5769><s%> in their hearts, <S%H3820><s%> yet so that <S%H1097><s%> man <S%H120><s%> can't <S%H4672><s%> find out the work <S%H4639><s%> that <S%H1097><s%> God <S%H430><s%> has done from the beginning <S%H7218><s%> even to the end. <S%H5490><s%>
I know <S%H3045><s%> that there is nothing better <S%H2896><s%> for them than to rejoice, <S%H8055><s%> and to do <S%H6213><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> as long as they live. <S%H2416><s%>

Also that every man <S%H120><s%> should eat <S%H398><s%> and drink, <S%H8354><s%> and enjoy <S%H7200><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> in all his labor, <S%H5999><s%> is the gift <S%H4991><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>

I know <S%H3045><s%> that whatever God <S%H430><s%> does, <S%H6213><s%> it shall be forever. <S%H5769><s%> Nothing <S%H369><s%> can be added <S%H3254><s%> to it, <S%H1639><s%> nor anything taken from it; <S%H430><s%> and God has done <S%H6213><s%> it, <S%H3372><s%> that men should fear before him. <S%H6440><s%>
That which is <S%H3528><s%> has been long ago, <S%H3528><s%> and that which is to be has been long ago: and God <S%H430><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> again that which is passed away. <S%H7291><s%>

Moreover I saw <S%H7200><s%> under the sun, <S%H8121><s%> in the place <S%H4725><s%> of justice, <S%H4941><s%> that wickedness <S%H7562><s%> was there; <S%H4725><s%> and in the place of righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> that wickedness was there. <S%H7562><s%>

I said <S%H559><s%> in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> "God <S%H430><s%> will judge <S%H8199><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%> and the wicked; <S%H7563><s%> for there is a time <S%H6256><s%> there for every purpose <S%H2656><s%> and for every work. <S%H4639><s%>"

I said <S%H559><s%> in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> "As for <S%H1700><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men, <S%H120><s%> God <S%H430><s%> tests <S%H1305><s%> them, <S%H7200><s%> so that they may see that they <S%H1992><s%> themselves are like animals. <S%H929><s%>

For that which happens <S%H4745><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> happens <S%H4745><s%> to animals. <S%H929><s%> Even one thing <S%H259><s%> happens <S%H4745><s%> to them. <S%H4194><s%> As the one dies, so the other <S%H2088><s%> dies. <S%H4194><s%> Yes, <S%H259><s%> they have all one breath; <S%H7307><s%> and man <S%H120><s%> has no advantage <S%H4195><s%> over the animals: <S%H929><s%> for all is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>
All go <S%H1980><s%> to one <S%H259><s%> place. <S%H4725><s%> All are from the dust, <S%H6083><s%> and all turn <S%H7725><s%> to dust <S%H6083><s%> again. <S%H7725><s%>

Who knows <S%H3045><s%> the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of man, <S%H1121><s%> whether it goes <S%H5927><s%> upward, <S%H4605><s%> and the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the animal, <S%H929><s%> whether it goes <S%H3381><s%> downward <S%H4295><s%> to the earth? <S%H776><s%>"

Therefore I saw <S%H7200><s%> that there is nothing better, <S%H2896><s%> than that a man <S%H120><s%> should rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in his works; <S%H4639><s%> for that is his portion: <S%H2506><s%> for who can bring <S%H935><s%> him to see <S%H7200><s%> what will be after him? <S%H310><s%>
